channel.title: BUbreakingSectionTwo
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from BUbreakingSectionTwo, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: Trump’s pick to lead NASA is a tech billionaire who made history completing the first-ever private spacewalk
item.description: If confirmed, Isaacman will replace Bill Nelson, 82, a former Democratic senator from Florida who was nominated by President Joe Biden.

item.title: Lawmakers Move to Impeach South Korean Leader After Failed Martial Law Bid
item.description: President Yoon Suk Yeol’s attempt to break a political deadlock by imposing military rule collapsed within hours, leaving him with few defenders. A vo...

item.title: Utah residents are exasperated after HOA plans to more than double monthly fees to $800: ‘There’s no way we’re ever going to be able to ever move out of here’
item.description: The homeowners association reportedly blamed rising costs of labor, supplies, and insurance.

item.title: Georgia Tumbles Deeper Into Crisis as Opposition Leader is Detained
item.description: In a sign of a widening crackdown, security agents have searched the offices and homes of prominent activists and opposition leaders who fear the coun...

item.title: Donald Trump and Pete Hegseth Have the Same Enemies
item.description: He, too, wants to fight the “enemy within.”

item.title: Iran Releases Narges Mohammadi, Nobel Laureate, From Prison for 21 Days
item.description: The activist, whose health has deteriorated, had bone surgery last month. She was just 19 when Iran’s morality police detained her.

item.title: Brian Thompson Was a Veteran Executive at UnitedHealthcare
item.description: Mr. Thompson managed a division that employs about 140,000 people and offers insurance plans to employers and individuals.

item.title: Warren Buffett’s 2 secrets for hiring great leaders
item.description: ‘You have to have a clear vision,’ Buffett told Fortune’s Susie Gharib at the Berkshire Hathaway shareholder meeting in 2015.

item.title: Lawmakers Move to Impeach South Korean Leader After Failed Martial Law Bid
item.description: President Yoon Suk Yeol’s attempt to break a political deadlock by imposing military rule collapsed within hours, leaving him with few defenders. A vo...

item.title: Georgia Tumbles Deeper Into Crisis as Opposition Leader is Detained
item.description: In a sign of a widening crackdown, security agents have searched the offices and homes of prominent activists and opposition leaders who fear the coun...

item.title: Trump plans to replace SEC chair Gary Gensler with crypto advocate Paul Atkins
item.description: Trump said Atkins, the CEO of Patomak Partners and a former SEC commissioner, was a “proven leader for common sense regulations.”

item.title: Researchers Release Hawaiian Crows Back Into the Wild
item.description: Researchers are trying a new strategy to reintroduce Hawaiian crows, which have been extinct in the wild for two decades.

item.title: ‘Hawk tuah’ girl Haliey Welch launches crypto memecoin—but insists it’s not a cash grab
item.description: An interview with the viral sensation as she wades into murky legal waters.

item.title: Biden Hopes Train Project in Angola Defines Africa Legacy
item.description: In his last announced trip abroad as president, Mr. Biden relished touring a U.S.-financed train line in Angola intended to transport goods and critic...

item.title: How South Korea's Impeachment of President Yoon Could Happen
item.description: A detailed look at each stage of the impeachment process, and what is to come for President Yoon.
